member.name: T:Microsoft.Maui.Easing
member.summary: Functions that modify values non-linearly, generally used for animations.
member.remarks: Easing functions are applied to input values in the range [0,1]. The cubic easing functions are often considered to look most natural. If developers wish to use their own easing functions, they should return a value of 0 for an input of 0 and a value of 1 for an input of 1 or the animation will have a jump.

member.summary: The default easing function that is used. Defaults to .

member.summary: Linear transformation.

member.summary: Smoothly decelerates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Easing.SinIn
member.summary: Smoothly accelerates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Easing.SinInOut
member.summary: Accelerates in and decelerates out.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Easing.CubicIn
member.summary: Starts slowly and accelerates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Easing.CubicOut
member.summary: Starts quickly and the decelerates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Easing.CubicInOut
member.summary: Accelerates and decelerates. Often a natural-looking choice.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Easing.BounceOut
member.summary: Leaps to final values, bounces 3 times, and settles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Easing.BounceIn
member.summary: Jumps towards, and then bounces as it settles at the final value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Easing.SpringIn
member.summary: Moves away and then leaps toward the final value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.Easing.SpringOut
member.summary: Overshoots and then returns.

member.summary: Gets the frame (x, y, w, h).

member.summary: The parent item.
member.value: The parent item, or null if the item is a root item.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.AlignContent
member.summary: This property defines how the layout engine will distribute space between and around child items that have been laid out on multiple lines. This property is ignored if the root item does not have its property set to Wrap or WrapReverse.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is Stretch.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.AlignItems
member.summary: This property defines how the layout engine will distribute space between and around child items along the cross-axis.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is Stretch.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.AlignSelf
member.summary: This property defines how the layout engine will distribute space between and around child items for a specific child along the cross-axis. If this property is set to Auto on a child item, the parent's value for will be used instead.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Basis
member.summary: This property defines the initial main-axis dimension of the item. If is row-based (horizontal), it will be used instead of , and if it's column-based (vertical), it will be used instead of .
member.remarks: The default value for this property is Auto.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Bottom
member.summary: This property defines the bottom edge absolute position of the item. It also defines the item's height if is also set and if isn't set. It is ignored if isn't set to Absolute.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is NaN.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Direction
member.summary: This property defines the direction and main-axis of child items. If set to Column (or ColumnReverse), the main-axis will be the y-axis and items will be stacked vertically. If set to Row (or RowReverse), the main-axis will be the x-axis and items will be stacked horizontally.
member.value: Any value part of the enumeration.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is Column.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Grow
member.summary: This property defines the grow factor of the item; the amount of available space it should use on the main-axis. If this property is set to 0, the item will not grow.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is 0 (does not take any available space).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Height
member.summary: This property defines the height size dimension of the item.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is NaN.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.JustifyContent
member.summary: This property defines how the layout engine will distribute space between and around child items along the main-axis.
member.value: Any value part of the enumeration, with the exception of Stretch and Auto.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is Start.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Left
member.summary: This property defines the left edge absolute position of the item.It also defines the item's width if is also set and if isn't set.It is ignored if isn't set to Absolute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Order
member.summary: This property specifies whether this item should be laid out before or after other items in the container.Items are laid out based on the ascending value of this property.Items that have the same value for this property will be laid out in the order they were inserted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.PaddingRight
member.summary: This property defines the height of the item's right edge padding space that should be used when laying out child items.
member.value: The bottom edge padding space.Negative values are not allowed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.PaddingTop
member.summary: This property defines the height of the item's top edge padding space that should be used when laying out child items.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Position
member.summary: This property defines whether the item should be positioned by the flexbox rules of the layout engine(Relative) or have an absolute fixed position (Absolute). If this property is set to Absolute, the, , and properties will then be used to determine the item's fixed position in its container.
member.value: Any value part of the enumeration.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is Relative

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Right
member.summary: This property defines the right edge absolute position of the item.It also defines the item's width if is also set and if isn't set.It is ignored if isn't set to Absolute.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is NaN.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Shrink
member.summary: This property defines the shrink factor of the item.In case the child items overflow the main-axis of the container, this factor will be used to determine how individual items should shrink so that all items can fill inside the container.If this property is set to 0, the item will not shrink.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is 1 (all items will shrink equally).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Top
member.summary: This property defines the top edge absolute position of the item. It also defines the item's height if is also set and if isn't set. It is ignored if isn't set to Absolute.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is NaN.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Width

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Layouts.Flex.Item.Wrap
member.summary: This property defines whether child items should be laid out in a single line(NoWrap) or multiple lines(Wrap or WrapReverse). If this property is set to Wrap or WrapReverse, can then be used to specify how the lines should be distributed.
member.value: Any value part of the enumeration.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is NoWrap.

remarks.para: The following contains a few important points from Right-to-Left Localization. Developers should consult that document for more information about limitations of right-to-left support, and for requirements to implement right-to-left support on various target platforms.

The default value of for a visual element that has no parent is , even on platforms where is . Therefore, developers must deliberately opt in to right-to-left layout. Developers can choose right-to-left layout by setting the property of the root element to to chosse right-to-left layout, or to to match the device layout.
All s that have a parent default to .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Maui.GridUnitType
member.summary: Enumerates values that control how the property is interpreted for row and column definitions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.GridUnitType.Absolute
member.summary: Interpret the property value as the number of device-specific units.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.GridUnitType.Star
member.summary: Interpret the property value as a proportional weight, to be laid out after rows and columns with or are accounted for.
member.remarks: After all the rows and columns of type and are laid out, each of the corresponding remaining rows or columns, which are of type , receive a fraction of the remaining available space. This fraction is determined by dividing each row's or column's property value by the sum of all the row or column property values, correspondingly, including its own.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Maui.GridUnitType.Auto
member.summary: Ignore the property value and choose a size that fits the children of the row or column.
